security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate machine learning development workflow containing standard ML patterns. The 75 static findings are FALSE POSITIVEs: hash identifiers misclassified as C2 keywords, markdown code fences misclassified as Ruby backtick execution, and hash strings misclassified as weak cryptography. All detected operations (file I/O, model serialization, distributed training) are standard ML engineering practices with no malicious intent.

medium_findings.title: CSV File Loading Without Validation
medium_findings.description: The skill loads CSV files with pd.read_csv() without path validation
medium_findings.reasoning: This is standard ML practice for loading training data. The skill operates on user-provided datasets in controlled environments. Users retain full control over their data and file paths.

medium_findings.title: External Command Execution via claude-flow
medium_findings.description: The skill executes npx claude-flow@alpha for skill orchestration
medium_findings.reasoning: This is the standard mechanism for skill execution in the Claude Flow framework. Arguments are controlled by the skill logic, not untrusted user input.

low_findings.title: Model File Serialization Without Integrity Checks
low_findings.description: Model files are saved and loaded without cryptographic verification
low_findings.reasoning: Standard ML practice. Users should verify model integrity in production environments if required by their security policy.

content.user_title: Build production-ready ML models with automated workflows
content.value_statement: Developing machine learning models requires expertise across data preparation, architecture selection, training, and deployment. This skill automates the entire ML pipeline with best practices built-in, delivering production-ready models in under 90 minutes.
actual_capabilities: Automated 5-phase ML pipeline from data to deployment
Supports DNN, CNN, RNN, and Transformer architectures
Exports models in Keras, TensorFlow, and TFLite formats
Generates evaluation reports and training visualizations
limitations: Input data must be in CSV format
Training time varies based on dataset size and complexity

best_practices: Always validate data quality before training - clean data produces better models
Monitor training curves for overfitting and adjust dropout or regularization
Test the deployment package locally before pushing to production
anti_patterns: Don't skip data exploration - understanding your data prevents model failures
Avoid training for too many epochs without early stopping to prevent overfitting
Never deploy models without testing on held-out validation data first

faq.question: Which ML frameworks are compatible?
faq.answer: The skill supports both TensorFlow and PyTorch. It automatically detects your environment and uses the appropriate framework.

faq.question: What is the maximum dataset size?
faq.answer: Limited by system memory. For datasets over 1GB, use distributed training with Flow-Nexus to split processing across multiple nodes.

faq.question: Can I integrate with existing MLOps pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, outputs standard formats (.h5, SavedModel, TFLite) that integrate with MLflow, Kubeflow, and other MLOps platforms.

faq.question: Is my data safe during processing?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally. No data is sent to external services unless you explicitly enable distributed training.

faq.question: What if training fails or performs poorly?
faq.answer: The skill includes automatic retry logic and hyperparameter adjustment. Check the evaluation report for improvement recommendations.

faq.question: How does this compare to AutoML platforms?
faq.answer: Unlike black-box AutoML, this skill provides full transparency with editable code, detailed metrics, and complete control over training.
